intro: Raddia malmeana, commonly known as the Malme's raddia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often vibrant flowers. Raddia malmeana is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to cool, moist conditions.
